Mingyi Wang

I'm a third year Master student in the College of Control Science and Engineering at Zhejiang University supervised by Prof. Guang Li. Prior to that, I obtained my B.Eng. from Zhejiang University.

Email  /  CV  /  Scholar  /  Github

Research

I am interested in Autonomous Driving.

Hybrid Silent Speech Interface Through Fusion of Electroencephalography and Electromyography.
Huiyan Li, Mingyi Wang, Guang Li,
INTERSPEECH, 2023
pdf / arXiv

This paper presents a hybrid SSI based on the converter between bimodal electrophysiological signals and audio signals. EEG and sEMG are fused through two sequence-to-sequence models, and multi-task losses are applied to achieve complementarity between speech intention and muscle activity in silent speech.

A Simple and Effective Multi-agent Joint Prediction Method for Autonomous Driving.
Wang, M., Zou, H., Liu, Y., et al.
2024 China Automation Congress (CAC)
Indexed by EI, awaiting publication

We study a simplified yet effective joint prediction methodology for multi-agent trajectory generation in autonomous driving applications, enhancing the accuracy of agent interaction modeling.

Camera-Lidar-Based Terrain Multi-type Classification Using Both Spatial and Histogram Features of Lidars.
Lu, Z., Wang, M., Yu, S., Wu, Y., Wang, Y., & Li, G.
2023 3rd International Conference on Computer, Control and Robotics (ICCCR)

We study a Lidar-camera fusion system for terrain classification in off-road robots, leveraging multiple optical channels in Lidars and depth-enhanced images to classify various terrain types. Our approach achieves a 99.47% accuracy across diverse terrains, demonstrating its robustness and efficiency.

Path Planning for Autonomous Driving with Curvature-considered Quadratic Optimization.
Zhang, Z., Zou, Z., Li, X., Wang, M., Wang, Y., & Guan, X., et al.
2023 IEEE Intelligent Vehicles Symposium (IV)

We propose an improved quadratic programming approach for path planning in autonomous driving that optimizes path smoothness and curvature using the Fren√©t frame, enhancing comfort and safety in urban environments.

Discrete States-Based Trajectory Planning for Nonholonomic Robots.
Zou, Z., Zhang, Z., Lu, Z., Li, X., Wang, M., & Wang, Y., et al.
2023 IEEE International Conference on Robotics and Biomimetics (ROBIO)

We propose a Discrete States-based Trajectory Planning (DSTP) algorithm for autonomous nonholonomic robots, improving trajectory smoothness, efficiency, and control through optimized multi-variable representation and L-BFGS-B optimization, validated by simulation and real-world experiments.

Experience

After graduating from my undergraduate studies, I spent my first year as an intern at my advisor's company, primarily working on spherical robot trajectory navigation using ROS and C++.

From August 2023 to February 2024, I interned at DJI Automotive in Shenzhen. Under the guidance of my advisor, Zhang Lu, I conducted research on learning-based trajectory generation methods and a unified framework for prediction and planning. Ultimately, this project was integrated into DJI Automotive's current end-to-end model.

In April 2024, I became a visiting student under Professor Kaicheng Yu at Westlake University. I then joined Udeer Intelligent for an internship, where I worked on a joint project exploring advanced agent interaction modeling methods and experimented with integrating them with reinforcement learning. This approach aimed to address the challenge of distribution shift in learning-based trajectory planning.

All these experiences have led me to where I am today.
